headline: Is There an Opportunity in Adobe After Shares Slide 35%?
summary: Deciding what to do with Adobe stock right now probably feels tougher than ever. After all, it's a household tech name, but recent returns have been less than inspiring. Over the last year, Adobe shares have slid almost 35%, and they are still down a hefty 20.8% for the year to date. Even when you zoom out, five-year performance is down 25.3%. That's a far cry from the days when it seemed like every year brought fresh highs. But look a little closer, and the short-term story gets more...

headline: Adobe price target lowered to $450 from $475 at Evercore ISI
summary: Evercore ISI analyst Kirk Materne lowered the firm’s price target on Adobe (ADBE) to $450 from $475 and keeps an Outperform rating on the shares. Adobe delivered “solid” fiscal 3Q results as revenue, NNARR, and EPS all exceeded expectations and the company noted significant progress around a number of initiatives, the analyst tells investors. At the current valuation, the firm believes that the market is “already baking in a huge amount of skepticism towards Adobe’s long-term growth,” but it als
